Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2013 12:29PM Shandy7 wrote: Thank you Ladies, Im prayin its nothing I got 7 kids and dont think I can handle anything else on top of my normal busy life=) I do have another question though they say it is a solid mass but doesnt have any blood flow. Is that a good or bad sign?
Posts.Title: Don't Understand my Mammogram report=/ Shandy7 Shandy7

Posts.Content: Shandy7 wrote: This is my Mammogram report. Age 29. I also had to go back for more mammos and ultrasounds because they found something else, either another lump or a swollen lymph node=( Thanks in advance. The patient presents with a palpable abnormality within the lower-inner quadrant of the left breast. Implants. Full fluid digital mammograms were obtained with CAD. The breast tissue is extremely dense, which lowers the sensitivity of mammography. Bilateral subpectoral saline implants are intact. In the area of palpable concern is a rounded,mostly circumscribed mass superficial in position measuring 1.3 cm.Â  Benign-appearing calcifications are seen in the left breast. In the superior left breast is an oval subcentimeter asymmetry. Targeted left breast sonogram was performed, which does reveal a lobulated partially circumscribed hypoechoic solid mass measuring 1.7 cm. Though this is superficial in position, this does not appear to extend into the dermis. Impression: (1) Solid, indeterminate mass in the seven o'clock position of the left breast as described. Left breast ultrasound-guided biopsy is recommended. (2) Subcentimeter asymmetry superiorly within the left breast. Focal spot compression view with possible ultrasound is recommended. BI-RADS Category 4: Suspicious abnormality-Biopsy shoul be considered. Log in to post a reply
